name: BBCWorld
text:
The US has over two million cases of coronavirus, the highest in the world

In recent days, several states have seen a record number of cases 

So what is going on in the US?

[Thread]
https://t.co/2xa9uRu41S

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Northeast - which includes New York and New Jersey - was the hardest hit region, but cases are now going down there

However, the South and West regions have seen a big rise in the number of infections

https://t.co/GprJB7zTIu https://t.co/Bq7bx6VueN

name: BBCWorld
text:
Some fear the rise in new cases is a sign of a second wave

But health official Dr Anthony Fauci says the US is actually ‚Äústill in a first wave" 

https://t.co/GprJB7zTIu https://t.co/hFvWnSeYRA

name: BBCWorld
text:
The US has conducted 25 million coronavirus tests, more than any other country 

President Trump blames the increase in cases on the fact the US is testing more 

But many believe there are other reasons for the recent rise in infections 

https://t.co/GprJB7zTIu https://t.co/oSsQo8Nv3D

name: BBCWorld
text:
The situation becomes clearer when you look at the rate of positive coronavirus tests

If the virus spread was reducing, then the rate of positive cases should go down too

https://t.co/GprJB7zTIu https://t.co/Xkzc3n3YdI

name: BBCWorld
text:
At the moment the number of tests coming back positive is just below 5% in the US, but it varies by state

The Worl‚Ä¶ https://t.co/NPoiCtetL5

name: BBCWorld
text:
Over 120,000 people have died from the virus in the US

More encouragingly, the daily death toll continues to fall

If deaths start edging up, there will be pressure to reintroduce restrictions 

Read more: https://t.co/GprJB7zTIu https://t.co/B7deONAdxz
